Courses.Name: THEOETH 5190B - ISLAMIC LAW & LEGAL THEORY
Description: A study of the history, practice and principles of Islamic law as understood by the major schools, with a focus on their ethical and theological foundations and their adaptations to changing times.

Notes: REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Any university-level course in Islamic Studies.
RESTRICTED TO THEOLOGY MASTERS STUDENTS AT HURON.

Courses.Name: THEOETH 5213A - ISLAMIC ETHICS
Description: An examination of principled reasoning in classical Islamic jurisprudence, the theological status of reason in Islam, the principles and priorities of traditional ethical reasoning, the arguments for a goal-oriented approach to ethics, the contemporary emphasis on the context of the ethicist and the construction of religious authority, and the importance of individual moral formation.
